itemDescription: English rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Frederick "Fred" William Lowrie (1 March 1868 – 9 August 1902) was an English rugby union and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1880s and 1890s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for England and Yorkshire, and at club level for Wakefield Trinity (were a rugby union club at the time, so no Heritage № is allocated), and Batley, as a forward, e.g. front row, lock, or back row, and club level rugby league (RL) for Batley, as a forward (prior to the specialist positions of; prop, hooker, second-row, loose forward), during the era of contested scrums. Prior to Thursday 29 August 1895, Batley, and Wakefield Trinity were both rugby union clubs.
